thread.title: Chelsea news: Conte tried two formations and still couldn't beat Dyche | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea news: Conte tried two formations and still couldn't beat Dyche | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett
title: Chelsea news: Conte tried two formations and still couldn't beat Dyche | Metro News
text:
Chelsea manager Antonio Conte tried two formations and still couldn’t out-tactic Sean Dyche Evan Bartlett Sunday 12 Feb 2017 6:17 pm Champions League: Burnley are fourth in the Premier League home games table (Getty Images) 
Sean Dyche is fondly known as the ‘Ginger Mourinho’ at Turf Moor and it wasn’t hard to see how he gained that reputation as he outmanoeuvred Chelsea boss Antonio Conte on Sunday afternoon. 
The league leaders lined up in their now familiar 3-4-3 formation against Burnley and it looked to be working once again as Pedro opened the scoring for the visitors in the seventh minute. 
But the Clarets – in a traditional 4-4-2 shape – pulled one back with a stunning free-kick from new boy Robbie Brady 17 minutes later and looked the stronger team thereafter despite conceding the majority of possession. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
Burnley missed two one-on-ones before half-time – first through Andre Gray and then Matthew Lowton – and could easily have gone 3-1 up. 
Conte only had goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois’ form to thank that his side were not trailing at the break. 
And that pattern continued in the second-half as Burnley’s midfield pair of Joey Barton and Ashley Westwood outran and outclassed N’Golo Kante and Nemanja Matic. 
It was the latter that eventually gave way, with Conte pulling off the Serbian midfielder in favour of Cesc Fabregas. Chelsea fixtures 
Swansea (H) – Sat 25 Feb West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Watford (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr 
But still Dyche’s side held on, with the man Conte likened to Andrea Pirlo making little impact. 
Minutes later the Italian brought Willian on in place of wing-back Victor Moses and and then Michy Batshuayi for Pedro and switched to a 4-4-2 of his own. 
And still, Dyche’s men held on. 
The game finished 1-1 as another unheralded English manager performed miracles. 
Paul Merson and Phil Thompson will be in dreamland…
